qas.question: What district is Lafayette Park a part of?

answers.text: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe residential district

qas.question: In which part of Detroit is Mexicantown International Welcome Center?

answers.text: Mies van der Rohe, Ludwig Hilberseimer and Alfred Caldwell

context: Lafayette Park is a revitalized neighborhood on the city's east side, part of the <a0_0>Ludwig Mies van der Rohe residential district<a0_0/>. The <a1_0>78-acre<a1_0/> (32 ha) development was originally called the Gratiot Park. Planned by <a3_0>Mies van der Rohe, Ludwig Hilberseimer and Alfred Caldwell<a3_0/> it includes a landscaped, 19-acre (7.7 ha) park with no through traffic, in which these and other low-rise apartment buildings are situated. Immigrants have contributed to the city's neighborhood revitalization, especially in southwest Detroit. <a2_0>Southwest Detroit<a2_0/> has experienced a thriving economy in recent years, as evidenced by new housing, increased business openings and the recently opened Mexicantown International Welcome Center.
